xxl.core.spatial.points

Class Points

  • java.lang.Object
    • xxl.core.spatial.points.Points

  • public abstract class Points
extends Object
    A utility-class that provides useful static methods for Points like distance methods and universe computations.
    See Also:
    Point, FloatPoint, DoublePoint, FixedPoint

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Points() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static double lpDistance(Point p1, Point p2, int p)
      Computes the L_p-distance of two Points.
      static double lpDistanceWithoutRoot(Point p1, Point p2, int p)
      Computes the L_p-distance of two Points WITHOUT performing the final 1/p power-operation.
      static Cursor mapToUnitCubeDouble(Iterator iterator, Rectangle universe)
      Transforms a given Iterator of DoublePoints to the unit-cube [0;1)^dim assuming that all Points are inside the given universe-DoublePointRectangle and that the Points are of type DoublePoint.
      static Cursor mapToUnitCubeFloat(Iterator iterator, Rectangle universe)
      Transforms a given Iterator of FloatPoints to the unit-cube [0;1)^dim assuming that all Points are inside the given universe-FloatPointRectangle and that the Points are of type FloatPoint.
      static double maxDistance(Point p1, Point p2)
      Computes the maximum-distance (=L_\infty-metric) between two given Points.
      static Cursor newDoublePointInputCursor(File file, int dim)
      A factory-method that returns an input-Iterator for DoublePoints of the given dimensionality

      A factory-method that returns an input-Iterator for FixedPoints of the given dimensionality.
      static Cursor newFloatPointInputCursor(File file, int dim)
      A factory-method that returns an input-Iterator for FloatPoints of the given dimensionality.
      static Rectangle universeDouble(Iterator input)
      Computes the minimal bounding rectangle (i.e. the "universe") of an Iterator of DoublePoint-objects.
      static Rectangle universeFloat(Iterator input)
      Computes the minimal bounding rectangle (i.e. the "universe") of an Iterator of FloatPoint-objects.
      static boolean withinMaximumDistance(Point p1, Point p2, double distance)
      Checks whether the the maximum-distance (=L_\infty-metric) of two Points is less equal than the given distance.

      • lpDistance

        public static double lpDistance(Point p1,
                                Point p2,
                                int p)
        Computes the L_p-distance of two Points.
        Parameters:
        p1 - Point 1
        p2 - Point 2
        p - the value of p
        Returns:
        returns the L_p-distance

      • lpDistanceWithoutRoot

        public static double lpDistanceWithoutRoot(Point p1,
                                           Point p2,
                                           int p)
        Computes the L_p-distance of two Points WITHOUT performing the final 1/p power-operation. This makes sense in situations where (|p1,p2|)^p is available which is often the case in ranking algorithms. By using this method one can save calls to the expensive Math.pow-operation.
        Parameters:
        p1 - Point 1
        p2 - Point 2
        p - value of p
        Returns:
        returns the L_p-distance of two points without performing 1/p power-operation

      • maxDistance

        public static double maxDistance(Point p1,
                                 Point p2)
        Computes the maximum-distance (=L_\infty-metric) between two given Points. Calculates the difference between coordinates for each dimension and returns maximum
        Parameters:
        p1 - first Point
        p2 - second Point
        Returns:
        returns the maximum coordinate difference for two points given

      • withinMaximumDistance

        public static boolean withinMaximumDistance(Point p1,
                                            Point p2,
                                            double distance)
        Checks whether the the maximum-distance (=L_\infty-metric) of two Points is less equal than the given distance. This method will return true if the coordinate difference between the points in any dimension is not bigger than the given distance
        Parameters:
        p1 - Point 1
        p2 - Point 2
        distance - the query distance
        Returns:
        returns true if the coordinate difference between the points in any dimension is not bigger than the given distance
        See Also:
        Predicate, DistanceWithin

      • newFixedPointInputCursor

        public static Cursor newFixedPointInputCursor(File file,
                                              int dim)
        A factory-method that returns an input-Iterator for FixedPoints of the given dimensionality.
        Parameters:
        file - the input flat file containing the FixedPoints
        dim - the dimensionality of the FixedPoints
        Returns:
        returns an input-Iterator for FixedPoints of the given dimensionality.

      • newFloatPointInputCursor

        public static Cursor newFloatPointInputCursor(File file,
                                              int dim)
        A factory-method that returns an input-Iterator for FloatPoints of the given dimensionality.
        Parameters:
        file - the input flat file containing the FloatPoints
        dim - the dimensionality of the FloatPoints
        Returns:
        returns an input-Iterator for FloatPoints of the given dimensionality.

      • newDoublePointInputCursor

        public static Cursor newDoublePointInputCursor(File file,
                                               int dim)
        A factory-method that returns an input-Iterator for DoublePoints of the given dimensionality
        Parameters:
        file - the input flat file containing the DoublePoints
        dim - the dimensionality of the DoublePoints
        Returns:
        returns an input-Iterator for DoublePoints of the given dimensionality.

      • mapToUnitCubeDouble

        public static Cursor mapToUnitCubeDouble(Iterator iterator,
                                         Rectangle universe)
        Transforms a given Iterator of DoublePoints to the unit-cube [0;1)^dim assuming that all Points are inside the given universe-DoublePointRectangle and that the Points are of type DoublePoint.
        Parameters:
        iterator - an Iterator containing DoublePoints
        universe - the minimal bounding rectangle of the Points
        Returns:
        cursor returning input DoublePoints converted to to the DoublePoints points in unit-cube [0;1)^dim

      • mapToUnitCubeFloat

        public static Cursor mapToUnitCubeFloat(Iterator iterator,
                                        Rectangle universe)
        Transforms a given Iterator of FloatPoints to the unit-cube [0;1)^dim assuming that all Points are inside the given universe-FloatPointRectangle and that the Points are of type FloatPoint.
        Parameters:
        iterator - an Iterator containing FloatPoints
        universe - the minimal bounding rectangle of the Points
        Returns:
        cursor returning input FloatPoints converted to to the FloatPoints points in unit-cube [0;1)^dim

      • universeDouble

        public static Rectangle universeDouble(Iterator input)
        Computes the minimal bounding rectangle (i.e. the "universe") of an Iterator of DoublePoint-objects. Note that this method is blocking since it has to consume the entire input-Iterator in order to compute the minimal bounding rectangle of the Points.
        Parameters:
        input - an Iterator containing DoublePoints
        Returns:
        returns DoublePointRectangle which is the MBR of the points given

      • universeFloat

        public static Rectangle universeFloat(Iterator input)
        Computes the minimal bounding rectangle (i.e. the "universe") of an Iterator of FloatPoint-objects. Note that this method is blocking since it has to consume the entire input-Iterator in order to compute the minimal bounding rectangle of the Points.
        Parameters:
        input - an Iterator containing FloatPoints
        Returns:
        returns FloatPointRectangle which is the MBR of the points given
